instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PMSLP_S4_L: What is PMSLP_S4_L? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PMSLP_S4_L, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B "Braindead" but CPU get's hot and has Vcore.
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in with what appeared to be no VCORE. Checked <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> and it was 0.97V.. SPI termination resistors OK as well. <SIGNAL>PMSLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> was missing, However I replaced the Clk chip and it was restored. ALLSYS Power Good present. 

**THIS BOARD HAS NO LIQUID DMG** 

The CPU gets hot as well when it is turned on. 

The board does not chime so I doubt it has a gfx chip issue. 

Usb mouse has no light. 

Thanks for any help provided.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B "Braindead" but CPU get's hot and has Vcore.
threads.message:
Close thread... GPU dead reheated and worked.... 

And no... I am not one that just senselessly heatguns crap for no reason lol

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B "Braindead" but CPU get's hot and has Vcore.
threads.message: This is going back as a no fix cause it's going to die
